title: 19th Century Emoticons
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824120316im_/http:/typophile.com/files/keppler14_4302.png)

Here's a piece from Puck Magazine (1881), featuring emoticons! Only 100 years ahead of their time. (courtesy Comic Book Resources)

[http://goodcomics.comicbookresources.com/2008/10/20/emoticons-from-the-1880s/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824120316/http:/goodcomics.comicbookresources.com/2008/10/20/emoticons-from-the-1880s/)
author: jasonc

comments.content: Haha, that is certainly amazing. I especially love the astonished and indifferent looks.

Gosh that brings back a memory! Around 1930 My mother took art lessons by correspondence from the ABC Art school in France. I think she learned from diagrams like this how one can draw different expressions. Later on she drew them for us when we were kids.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824120316im_/http:/typophile.com/files/three%20faces_6643.GIF)
